alert.note: Alert for Alexander (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN ALEXANDER COUNTY THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southwest of Taylorsville, or 4 miles northeast of Bethlehem, moving east at 5 mph. New storms may develop on the west side of this storm. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Taylorsville, Bethlehem, Lake Hickory, Millersville, Little River In Alexander County, and Ellendale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
